page.title: 20Maypole Dancing at Offenham.
page.content: Maypole dancing takes place in Offenham on {Wake Day},which is an annual event.Children from the village rehearse the dancing for about six weeks.Rehearsals usually last about an hour.At the first rehearsal we choose our ribbon colour.There are four colours red,green,blue,and white.Then we have to learn the dances,which involve making patterns with the ribbons,whilst skipping around the Maypole.The week before the Wake we collect our skirts,which match the colour of the ribbons.We also wear a white blouse,socks and pumps.There are lots of dances.We begin with the entrance dance and then do other dances including the gypsy tent,and then we finish with the exit.I feel very nervous to start with,but when the music begins I enjoy it all.
